descriptions: p:I'm Dr Naomi Fisher. I'm a clinical psychologist. That means I'm a psychologist who specialises in mental health and behaviour, and I work with a lot of young people and their families.
p:This course is for young people and also their parents if they want to watch. It's about anxiety
p:Using videos from a young person called Jenna I'll describe what anxiety is and talk about 'anxiety snares'.
p:I'll define anxiety and:

li:
I'll describe some of the things that you can to do to help.
p:I'll describe some of the things that you can to do to help.

li:
Jenna will describe how she got better and how she took small steps at the beginning
p:Jenna will describe how she got better and how she took small steps at the beginning
p:I'll talk about how you can be easier on yourself, and how you can start making the first small steps to recover from anxiety.
h3:Information
p:This course is available to watch for 12 months after purchase.
p:It is suitable for children with and without a diagnosis
h3:Agenda
li:Introduction (1 min)
li:What is anxiety (13 mins)
li:Why won't anxiety just go away (6 mins)
li:The anxiety snares (16 mins)
li:Getting out of the anxiety snares (32 mins)
p:Total running time: 1 hour 8 mins
h3:Presenter

p:Dr Naomi Fisher is a clinical psychologist and author. She specialises in trauma, autism and alternative approaches to education. She is registered with the HCPC. This course is not therapy and should not be used as a replacement for therapy.
